subject: [Mhln] Alvin
body: Or else, like us, sunk into some long gazeEverywhere, utterly.Only a fox whose den I cannot find.IV. The Paths to CathayBillows the fog, cloaksOnly a fox whose den I cannot find.A salamander scuttles across the quietIn the woods, close by,My soul lies cracked; and when, in its despair,"Be off!" say Winter's snows;VII. Hudson and His Strait; Baffin and His BayBy bloody pool—rattling, gasping his last.Columbuses or Gamas, ever pass,Billows the fog, cloaksAnd I would likeYes. You'd want that said, (if youthen takes a step back, to be safe as she reaches.Onto my frozen fingers.When Arctic winds crack down from Canada
